column1: In Ranasinghe v. Premadharma and Others [(1985) 1 Sri.L.R. 63 at 70] Sharvananda

column2: “In cases where the doctrine of approbation and reprobation applies, the person
concerned has a choice of two rights, either of which he is at liberty to adopt,
but not both. When the doctrine does apply, if the person to whom the choice

column3: full  knowledge  accepts  the  one,  he  cannot

column2: afterwards assert the other; he cannot affirm and disaffirm.”
